meta.condition: Good (Assumed based on form lines/standard prep)
meta.intelligence_summary: The 'Randwick of the South' is in play. The 390m straight and spacious layout will heavily favor horses with a turn of foot over gritty on-pace grinders, though the Waterhouse/Bott runner in R6 demands respect on speed. Expect Sydney metro stables (O'Shea, Snowden, Waterhouse, Baker) to exert dominance over local country form, particularly in the Maidens and Class 1s.

selections.name: Classic Touch
selections.reason: Showed early promise with a 2nd on debut. The Collings stable targets these local maidens effectively. Should improve off the race experience.

selections.name: Aerial Blaze
selections.reason: Resuming for Luke Pepper. Market support (9/1) suggests some confidence, and Pepper can ready them first up.

selections.name: Mah Ali
selections.reason: Consistent form lines (3rd, 2nd, 2nd) leading into this. The mile at Goulburn suits her grinding style, and she looks ready to peak.

selections.name: Homeric
selections.reason: Peter Snowden runner dropping from provincial/metro grade. The spacious track suits his running style.

selections.name: Xcessive Force
selections.reason: Danielle Seib has this mare flying. Coming off a dominant win and maps to get a lovely run. Short price justified.

selections.name: Ghost Walker
selections.reason: Stablemate to the top pick. Has excellent overall stats and handles the distance well.

selections.name: Dubbo Boy
selections.reason: Danny Williams and Nick Heywood are a lethal combination at Goulburn. Last start win was authoritative.

selections.name: Romanticism
selections.reason: Won maiden well at Gundagai. Collings stable is astute; this horse has upside.

selections.name: Stormfield
selections.reason: Gary Portelli runner who won well at this track/grade last start. Ticks the 'Sydney Stables' handicapping angle.

selections.name: Bombay Boom
selections.reason: Recent win at Albury was sharp. Matthew Dale places them well.

selections.name: Bellarata
selections.reason: Waterhouse/Bott runner. Likely to have high cruising speed which can break hearts even on the big Goulburn track.

selections.name: El Qasabi
selections.reason: Provincial placings at Wyong suggest he is better than this field. The danger if the pace is hot.

selections.name: Toussaint
selections.reason: The standout of the day. Placing in a Randwick Grade 1 and Kembla Grade 3 puts her lengths ahead of this field on class. The long straight seals the deal.

selections.name: Sinister
selections.reason: Bjorn Baker runner. Should run well, but racing for second place if Toussaint shows up.
